additionalVersionWeight.description: The weight of the canary release version.

additionalProperties.description: The canary release ratio. The value is a decimal between 0 and 1.

createdTime.description: The time when the alias was created.

lastModifiedTime.description: The time when the alias was modified.

versionId.description: The version to which the alias points.

AsyncConfig.description: The information about the asynchronous invocation configurations.

asyncTask.description: Specifies whether to enable the asynchronous task feature.

createdTime.description: The time when the asynchronous invocation configuration was created.

functionArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the function.

lastModifiedTime.description: The time when the asynchronous invocation was last modified.

maxAsyncEventAgeInSeconds.description: The maximum time to live (TTL) value of an event.

maxAsyncRetryAttempts.description: The number of times when an asynchronous invocation is retried.

AsyncTask.description: The information about the asynchronous task.

alreadyRetriedTimes.description: The number of retries after the asynchronous task fails.

destinationStatus.description: The final state of the asynchronous task.

durationMs.description: The execution duration of the asynchronous task.

endTime.description: The end time of the asynchronous task. Unit: milliseconds.

events.description: The events of the asynchronous task.

items.description: The event of the asynchronous task.

functionArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the function.

instanceId.description: The ID of the instance that corresponds to the asynchronous task.

qualifier.description: The version or alias of the function.

requestId.description: The ID of the request corresponding to this asynchronous task.

returnPayload.description: The content of the response after the asynchronous task is executed. The maximum size is 1 MB. This parameter is in public preview. If you want to use this parameter, [contact us](~~2513733~~).

startedTime.description: The start time of the asynchronous task. Unit: milliseconds.

status.description:
The state of the asynchronous task.

*   Enqueued: The asynchronous invocation is enqueued and waiting to be executed.
*   Succeeded: The invocation is successful.
*   Failed: The invocation fails.
*   Running: The invocation is being executed.
*   Stopped: The invocation is terminated.
*   Stopping: The invocation is being terminated.
*   Invalid: The invocation is invalid and not executed due to specific reasons. For example, the function is deleted.
*   Expired: The maximum validity period of messages is specified for asynchronous invocation. The invocation is discarded and not executed because the specified maximum validity period of messages expires.
*   Retrying: The asynchronous invocation is being retried due to an execution error.

taskErrorMessage.description: The error message for an asynchronous task failure.

taskId.description: The ID of the asynchronous task.

taskPayload.description: The content of the input parameter during asynchronous task execution.

AsyncTaskEvent.description: The details of the task event.

eventDetail.description: The details of the event payload.

status.description:
The state of the event.

*   Enqueued: The asynchronous invocation is enqueued and is waiting to be executed.
*   Succeeded: The invocation is successful.
*   Failed: The invocation fails.
*   Running: The invocation is being executed.
*   Stopped: The invocation is terminated.
*   Stopping: The invocation is being terminated.
*   Invalid: The invocation is invalid and not executed due to specific reasons. For example, the function is deleted.
*   Expired: The maximum validity period of messages is specified for asynchronous invocation. The invocation is discarded and not executed because the specified maximum validity period of has elapsed.
*   Retrying: The asynchronous invocation is being retried due to an execution error.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the event occurred. Unit: milliseconds.

AuthConfig.description: The information about the configurations of permission authentication.

authType.description: The authentication type. Valid values: anonymous, function, and jwt.

BatchWindow.description: The batch window configurations for the EventBridge trigger.

CountBasedWindow.description: The maximum number of events that are allowed in the batch window. When this threshold is reached, data in the window is pushed downstream. If multiple batch windows exist, data is pushed if triggering conditions are met in one of the windows.

TimeBasedWindow.description: The maximum period of time during which events are allowed in the batch window. Unit: seconds. When this threshold is reached, data in the window is pushed downstream. If multiple batch windows exist, data is pushed if triggering conditions are met in one of the windows.

CDNTriggerConfig.description: The configurations of the Alibaba Cloud CDN trigger.

eventName.description: The name of the trigger event. For more information, see [CDN events](~~2513636~~).

eventVersion.description: The version of the trigger event. Only the 1.0.0 event version is supported.

filter.description: The details of the event filtering rules.

additionalProperties.description: The collection of event filtering rules.

items.description: The key string for event filtering.

privateKey.description: The private key in the .pem format.

ConcurrencyConfig.description: The information about function concurrency configurations.

reservedConcurrency.description: The reserved concurrency of the function. Other functions cannot use the concurrency. The reserved concurrency includes the total concurrency of provisioned instances and on-demand instances.

CreateAliasInput.description: The request parameter for creating an alias.

additionalVersionWeight.description: The weight of the canary release version.

versionId.description: The version to which the alias points.

CreateCustomDomainInput.description: The information about the request for creating a custom domain name.

certConfig.description: The configuration of the HTTPS certificate.

domainName.description: The domain name. Enter a custom domain name that has obtained an Internet content provider (ICP) filing in the Alibaba Cloud ICP Filing system, or a custom domain name whose ICP filing information includes Alibaba Cloud as a service provider.

protocol.description: The protocol type that is supported by the custom domain name. Valid values: HTTP HTTPS HTTP,HTTPS

routeConfig.description: The route table that maps paths to functions when the function is invoked by using the custom domain name.

CreateFunctionInput.description: The information about request parameters to create the function.

code.description: The code of the function. The code must be packaged into a .zip file. You must configure either the code parameter or the customContainerConfig parameter.

cpu.description: The number of vCPUs of the function. The value is a multiple of 0.05.

customContainerConfig.description: The configuration of the Custom Container runtime. After you configure the Custom Container runtime, Function Compute can execute the function in a Custom Container image. You must configure either the code parameter or the customContainerConfig parameter.

customDNS.description: The custom Domain Name System (DNS) settings.

customRuntimeConfig.description: The configuration of the custom runtime.

diskSize.description: The disk size of the function. Unit: MB. Valid values: 512 and 10240.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables of the function. You can access the environment variables configured in the runtime.

functionName.description: The name of the function. The name can contain only letters, digits, underscores (\_), and hyphens (-). The name cannot start with a digit or a hyphen (-). The name must be 1 to 64 characters in length.

gpuConfig.description: The GPU configuration of the function.

handler.description: The handler of the function. The handler format is related to the runtime you use.

instanceConcurrency.description: The number of requests that can be concurrently processed by the instance.

instanceLifecycleConfig.description: The configuration of the lifecycle hook for the function instance.

layers.description: The layers. Multiple layers are merged based on the order of array subscripts. The content of a layer with a smaller subscript overwrites the file that has the same name as a layer with a larger subscript.

items.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the layer.

logConfig.description: The log configuration. Function Compute writes function execution logs to the specified Logstore.

memorySize.description: The memory size of the function. Unit: MB. The value must be a multiple of 64. The memory size varies based on the function instance type you use.

nasConfig.description: The configuration of the Apsara File Storage NAS (NAS) file system. This allows functions in the specified service to access the NAS file system.

ossMountConfig.description: The mount configuration of Object Storage Service (OSS).

role.description: The Resource Access Management (RAM) role that is used to grant the required permissions to Function Compute. You can use the RAM role in the following scenarios: 1. Send the logs that the function generates to your Logstore. 2. Generate temporary tokens that are used to access other cloud resources during function execution.

timeout.description: The timeout period for the execution of the function. Unit: seconds. Default value: 3. Minimum value: 1. When this period is elapsed, the function execution is terminated.

tracingConfig.description: The configuration of Managed Service for OpenTelemetry. After Function Compute is integrated with Managed Service for OpenTelemetry, you can record the duration of a request in Function Compute, view the cold start duration of a function, and record the execution duration of a function.

vpcConfig.description: The VPC configuration. This allows functions in the specified service to access the specified VPC.

CreateLayerVersionInput.description: The information about the request parameters for creating a layer version.

code.description: The code information of the layer.

compatibleRuntime.description: The runtimes that are supported by the layer.

description.description: The description of the layer version.

license.description: The license agreement for the layer.

CreateTriggerInput.description: The information about request parameters to create the trigger.

invocationRole.description: The RAM role that is used by the event source such as Object Storage Service (OSS) to invoke the function.

qualifier.description: The version or alias of the function.

sourceArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the trigger event source.

triggerConfig.description:
The configurations of the trigger. The configurations vary based on the trigger type. The following items list the data structures for different types of triggers:

*   OSS triggers: [OSSTriggerConfig](~~2766465~~).
*   Simple Log Service trigger: [LogTriggerConfig](~~2618711~~).
*   Time triggers: [TimerTriggerConfig](~~2754638~~).
*   HTTP triggers: [HTTPTriggerConfig](~~2766461~~).
*   Tablestore triggers: Specify the **SourceArnm** parameter and leave this parameter empty.
*   Alibaba Cloud CDN event triggers: [CDNEventsTriggerConfig](~~2766462~~).
*   MNS topic triggers: [MnsTopicTriggerConfig](~~2766464~~).
*   EventBridge-based triggers: [EventBridgeTriggerConfig](~~2766447~~).

triggerName.description: The name of the trigger. The name can contain only letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length and cannot start with a digit or a hyphen (-).

triggerType.description:
The type of the trigger. Valid values:

*   **oss**: OSS event triggers. For more information, see [Overview](~~2513613~~).
*   **log**: Simple Log Service triggers. For more information, see [Simple Log Service triggers](~~2513638~~).
*   **timer**: time triggers. For more information, see [Time triggers](~~2513611~~).
*   **http**: HTTP triggers. For more information, see [Overview](~~2513634~~).
*   **tablestore**: Tablestore triggers. For more information, see [Tablestore triggers](~~2513640~~).
*   **cdn_events**: CDN event triggers. For more information, see [Overview](~~2513636~~).
*   **mns_topic**: Message Service (MNS) topic triggers. For more information, see [MNS topic triggers](~~2513641~~).
*   **eventbridge**: EventBridge-based triggers.

CreateVpcBindingInput.description: The information about request parameters for creating and binding a virtual private cloud (VPC).

CustomContainerConfig.description: The configurations of the Custom Container runtime.

accelerationType.description: Specifies whether to enable image acceleration. Valid values: Default: enables image acceleration. None: disables image acceleration.

acrInstanceId.description: The ID of the image repository for the Container Registry Enterprise Edition. You must specify this parameter if you use an image of Container Registry Enterprise Edition.

command.description: The startup parameter of the container.

healthCheckConfig.description: The custom health check configurations of the function.

image.description: The endpoint of the container image.

port.description: The port on which the HTTP server listens for the Custom Container runtime.

resolvedImageUri.description: The actual digest version of the deployed image. The code version specified by digest is actually used when the function starts. This parameter is returned by GetFunction and is not required as a parameter.

CustomDNS.description: The information about the custom Domain Name System (DNS) configurations of the function.

dnsOptions.description: The DNS resolution configurations in the resolv.conf file. Each item corresponds to a key-value pair in the key:value format, in which the key is required.

nameServers.description: The IP addresses of the DNS server.

searches.description: The search domains of DNS server.

items.description: The search domain of the DNS server.

CustomDomain.description: The information about the custom domain name.

accountId.description: The ID of your Alibaba Cloud account.

apiVersion.description: The version of the Function Compute API.

certConfig.description: The configuration of the HTTPS certificate.

createdTime.description: The time when the custom domain name was created.

lastModifiedTime.description: The time when the custom domain name was last updated.

protocol.description: The protocol type that is supported by the custom domain name. Valid values: HTTP HTTPS HTTP,HTTPS

routeConfig.description: The route table that maps paths to functions when the function is invoked by using the custom domain name.

CustomHealthCheckConfig.description: The information about the custom health check configurations of the function. This parameter is applicable only to custom runtimes and Custom Container runtimes.

failureThreshold.description: The threshold for health check failures. When this value is reached, the system considers the health check failed. Valid values: 1 to 120. Default value: 3.

httpGetUrl.description: The health check URL of the custom container. The URL can be up to 2,048 characters in length.

initialDelaySeconds.description: The delay between the container startup and the health check. Valid values: 0 to 120. Default value: 0.

periodSeconds.description: The health check period. Valid values: 1 to 120. Default value: 3.

successThreshold.description: The threshold for health check successes. When this value is reached, the system considers the health check successful. Valid values: 1 to 120. Default value: 1.

timeoutSeconds.description: The timeout period of the health check. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 1 to 3. Default value: 1.

CustomRuntimeConfig.description: The information about the configurations of the custom runtime.

args.description: The arguments that are passed to the startup command.

items.description: The argument that is passed to the startup command.

healthCheckConfig.description: The custom health check configuration of the function.

port.description: The port on which the HTTP server is listening.

DeadLetterQueue.description: The dead-letter queue configurations for the EventBridge trigger.

Arn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the dead-letter queue.

DeliveryOption.description: The event push configurations of the EventBridge trigger.

concurrency.description: The maximum number of concurrent events that can be delivered by the upstream event source to Function Compute. This parameter is valid only when ApsaraMQ for Kafka is used as the event source.

eventSchema.description: The format of each data element in the event parameter of the function. CloudEvents: describes event data in a common format, including event description and event payload data. CloudEvents is designed to simplify event declaration and transmission between different services and platforms. This is the default value. RawData: delivers only the event payload data and does not include other metadata information in the CloudEvents format.

Destination.description: The struct of the destination for the asynchronous invocation.

destination.description: The descriptor of the destination for the asynchronous invocation.

DestinationConfig.description: The information about the configurations of the destination for the asynchronous invocation.

onFailure.description: The destination struct of a failed callback.

onSuccess.description: The destination struct of a successful callback.

DNSOption.description: The information about Domain Name System (DNS) configurations.

name.description: The name of the configuration item.

value.description: The value of the configuration item.

EqualRule.description: The configurations of exact match-based rewrite rules of custom domain names.

Error.description: The details of the error message.

EventBridgeTriggerConfig.description: The configurations of the EventBridge-based trigger.

asyncInvocationType.description:
Specifies whether to invoke the function in asynchronous mode. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

>  The default value is **false**.

eventRuleFilterPattern.description: The event pattern. The JSON format. For more information, see [Event patterns](~~181432~~).

triggerEnable.description:
Specifies whether to enable the trigger. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

>  The default value is **true**.

EventSinkConfig.description: The sink-side configurations of the EventBridge trigger

EventSourceConfig.description: The event source configurations of the EventBridge trigger.

eventSourceParameters.description: The event source. Custom event sources include Message Service (MNS), ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ, ApsaraMQ for RabbitMQ, ApsaraMQ for Kafka, ApsaraMQ for MQTT, and Data Transmission Service (DTS).

eventSourceType.description:
The event source type. Valid values:

*   **Default**: Alibaba Cloud EventBridge sources
*   **MNS**: Message Service (MNS)
*   **RocketMQ**: ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ
*   **RabbitMQ**: ApsaraMQ for RabbitMQ
*   **Kafka**: ApsaraMQ for Kafka
*   **MQTT**: ApsaraMQ for MQTT
*   **DTS**: DTS

>  This parameter cannot be updated. If you specify this parameter when you update the configurations, it does not take effect.

EventSourceParameters.description: The custom event source configurations for EventBridge triggers.

sourceDTSParameters.description: The custom configurations when the event source is Data Transmission Service (DTS).

sourceKafkaParameters.description: The custom configurations when the event source is ApsaraMQ for Kafka.

sourceMNSParameters.description: The custom configurations when the event source is Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS).

sourceMQTTParameters.description: The custom configurations when the event source is ApsaraMQ for MQTT.

sourceRabbitMQParameters.description: The custom configurations when the event source is ApsaraMQ for RabbitMQ.

sourceRocketMQParameters.description: The custom configurations when the event source is ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ.

Filter.description: The filter configurations of the Object Storage Service (OSS) trigger.

key.description: The description of the event filtering rule.

codeChecksum.description: The CRC-64 value of the function code package.

codeSize.description: The size of the function code package returned by the system. Unit: bytes.

cpu.description: The CPU size of the function. Unit: vCPUs. The value is a multiple of 0.05. The minimum value is 0.05 and the maximum value is 16. The ratio of cpu to memorySize (GB) must be from 1:1 to 1:4.

createdTime.description: The time when the function was created.

customContainerConfig.description: The configurations of the Custom Container runtime. After you configure the Custom Container runtime, Function Compute can execute the function by using a Custom Container image. Configure either code or customContainerConfig.

customDNS.description: The custom DNS settings of the function.

customRuntimeConfig.description: The configurations of the custom runtime.

diskSize.description: The disk size of the function. Unit: MB. Valid values: 512 and 10240.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables of the function. You can access the environment variables configured in the runtime.

additionalProperties.description: The value of the environment variable.

functionArn.description: The identifier of the function resource.

functionId.description: The unique ID generated by the system for the function.

gpuConfig.description: The GPU configurations of the function.

handler.description: The handler of the function. The handler format is related to the runtime you use.

internetAccess.title: service config
internetAccess.description: Specifies whether to allow functions to access the Internet. Default value: true.

lastModifiedTime.description: The time when the function was last modified.

lastUpdateStatus.description: The state of the function in the last update operation. If the function was successfully created, the value is Successful. Valid values: Successful, Failed, and InProgress.

lastUpdateStatusReason.description: The reason that the function is in the current state in the last update operation.
lastUpdateStatusReason.example: The system is currently processing the acceleration optimization for the image.

lastUpdateStatusReasonCode.description: The reason code for the function's current state.

logConfig.description: The log configurations. Function Compute writes function execution logs to the specified Logstore.

memorySize.description: The memory capacity for the function. Unit: MB. The memory capacity must be a multiple of 64 MB. The minimum value is 128 MB and the maximum value is 32 GB. The ratio of cpu to memorySize (GB) must be from 1:1 to 1:4.

nasConfig.description: The Apsara File Storage NAS (NAS) configurations. The configurations allow the function to access the specified NAS file system.

ossMountConfig.description: The Object Storage Service (OSS) mounting configurations.

role.description: The RAM role that is assigned to Function Compute. After the RAM role is configured, Function Compute assumes the RAM role to generate temporary access credentials. The temporary access credentials of this role can be used in functions to access specified Alibaba Cloud services, such as OSS and Tablestore.

runtime.description: The runtime of the function. Valid values: nodejs8, nodejs10, nodejs12, nodejs14, nodejs16, nodejs18, nodejs20, go1, python3, python3.9, python3.10, java8, java11, php7.2, dotnetcore3.1, custom, custom.debian10, and custom-container.

state.title: function state
state.description: The current state of the function.

stateReason.description: The reason why the function is in the current state.

stateReasonCode.description: The reason code for the function's current state

timeout.description: The timeout period of the function. Unit: seconds. The value ranges from 1 to 86400. The default value is 3. When this period elapses, the function execution is terminated.

tracingConfig.description: The configuration of Managed Service for OpenTelemetry. After Function Compute is integrated with Managed Service for OpenTelemetry, you can record the duration of a request in Function Compute, view the cold start duration of a function, and record the execution duration of a function.

vpcConfig.description: The VPC configurations. The configurations allow the function to access the specified VPC.

FunctionLayer.description: The information about the function layer configurations.

arn.description: The resource identifier of the layer version.

size.description: The size of the layer code package. Unit: bytes.

resouceType.description: The name of the resource type. Valid values: ALIYUN::FC::FUNCTION and ALIYUN::FC::SERVICE. The former name is used in Function Compute 3.0, and the latter name is used in earlier versions of Function Compute.

resourceArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

GPUConfig.description: The GPU configurations of the function.

gpuMemorySize.description: The GPU memory size. Unit: MB. The value is a multiple of 1024 MB.

gpuType.description: The type of GPU cards. Valid values: fc.gpu.tesla.1: Tesla T4 fc.gpu.ampere.1: Ampere A10

urlInternet.description: The public domain address. You can access HTTP triggers over the Internet by using HTTP or HTTPS.

urlIntranet.description: The private endpoint. In a VPC, you can access HTTP triggers by using HTTP or HTTPS.

authType.description:
The authentication type. Valid values:

*   **function**: requires authentication.
*   **anonymous**: does not require authentication.

>  The default value is **function**

disableURLInternet.description: Specifies whether to disable access to the default Internet domain. If you set this parameter to true, a 403 error is returned if you access the default public URL provided by the function. A value of false does not have affect the running of the function.

methods.description: The list of request methods. Multiple methods are supported.

items.description:
The request method. Valid values:

*   HEAD
*   DELETE
*   POST
*   GET
*   OPTIONS
*   PUT
*   PATCH

InputCodeLocation.description:
The code configurations of the function. Code packages can be provided in the following methods:

1.  Include content of a code package in requests. In this case, zipFile must be set.
2.  Upload a code package to Object Storage Service (OSS). Include the path of the OSS object in requests. In this case, you must set ossBucketName and ossObjectName.

checksum.description: The CRC-64 value of the function code package. If checksum is provided, Function Compute checks whether the checksum of the code package is the same as that provided.

ossBucketName.description: The name of the OSS bucket where the ZIP package of the function code is stored.

ossObjectName.description: The name of the OSS object where the ZIP package of the function code is stored.

zipFile.description: The ZIP package of the function code that is encoded in Base64 format.

InstanceInfo.description: The information about the function instance.

versionId.description: The version of the function to which the instance belongs. If the instance belongs to the LATEST alias, 0 is returned as the version.

InstanceLifecycleConfig.description: The configurations of the lifecycle hook for the function instance.

initializer.description: The configurations of the Initializer hook.

preStop.description: The configurations of the PreStop hook.

JobConfig.description: The trigger task configurations of Simple Log Service.

maxRetryTime.description: The maximum number of retries. Valid values: 0 to 100. This parameter specifies the maximum number of retries allowed when Simple Log Service triggers a function based on the trigger interval if an error occurs, such as insufficient permissions, network failures, and function execution exceptions. If the trigger fails after the maximum number of retries is reached, Simple Log Service triggers the function again when the next trigger interval arrives.

triggerInterval.description: The time interval at which Simple Log Service triggers function execution. For example, you can retrieve data from the Logstore within the last 120 seconds to Function Compute every 120 seconds to perform custom computing.

Key.description: The filter rules of the OSS trigger.

prefix.description: The prefix that is used to filter the event-related resources. Only events related to the resources whose names are prefixed with the specified value of Prefix are traced. For example, if you set Prefix to serverless\_, only events related to the resources that are prefixed with serverless\_ can trigger the function.

suffix.description: The suffix that is used to filter the event-related resources. Only events related to the resources whose names are suffixed with the specified value of Suffix are traced. For example, if you set Suffix to .zip, only events related to the resources that are suffixed with .zip can trigger the function.

acl.description: The permission of the layer. Valid value: 0 and 1. 0 specifies that the layer is private, and 1 specifies that the layer is public. By default, public layers are public. Custom layers can be set to private or public.

code.description: The information about the code package of the layer.

codeChecksum.description: The crc64 verification code of the layer code package, which is calculated based on ECMA-182.

codeSize.description: The size of the layer code package. Unit: bytes.

compatibleRuntime.description: The runtimes that are supported by the layer.

createTime.description: The time when the layer version was created.

description.description: The description of the layer version.

layerVersionArn.description: The name of the resource in the layer version. The name is in the acs:fc:{region}:{accountID}:layers/{layerName}/versions/{layerVersion} format.

LifecycleHook.description: The configurations of the lifecycle hook for the function instance.

handler.description: The handler of the hook. The definition is similar to that of a request handler.

timeout.description: The timeout period of the hook. Unit: seconds.

ListAsyncInvokeConfigOutput.description: The information about the response to the asynchronous invocation.

configs.description: The configurations of the asynchronous invocation.

items.description: The configuration of the asynchronous invocation.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken.

ListAsyncTaskOutput.description: Lists the responses of asynchronous tasks.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If NextToken is empty, no next page exists.

ListConcurrencyConfigsOutput.description: The concurrency configurations of the function.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If this parameter is not returned, all the concurrency configurations are returned.

ListCustomDomainOutput.description: The information about the response that is returned to obtain custom domain names.

items.description: The details of the custom domain name.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken.

ListFunctionsOutput.description: The information about the response to functions.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If NextToken is empty, no next page exists.
The name of the start layer for the next query, which is also the token used to obtain more results.

ListLayerVersionOutput.description: The configurations of getting versions of the specified layer.

nextVersion.description: The next version, which is used to return more results.

ListProvisionConfigsOutput.description: The information about provisioned configurations of the function.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If NextToken is empty, no next page exists.

provisionConfigs.description: The provisioned configurations of the function.

items.description: The information about the provisioned configuration.

ListTaggedResourcesOutput.description: The information about the tagged resources.

nextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken.

ListTagResourcesOutput.description: Queries the information about the resources to which a specified tag is bound.

NextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken.

TagResources.description: The information about the queried resources and tags.

items.description: The resource and tag information, including the resource ID, resource type, and tag key.

ListTriggersOutput.description: The information about the response struct to obtain triggers.

nextToken.description: The name of the next trigger. The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If this parameter is not returned, all the layers are returned.

ListVersionsOutput.description: The request parameters for listing versions.

nextToken.description: The ID of the next version.

ListVpcBindingsOutput.description: The request parameters for listing all virtual private cloud (VPC) bindings of a service or function.

enableInstanceMetrics.description: Specifies whether to enable the collection of instance-level metrics. If you enable this feature, you can view core metrics, such as CPU utilization, memory usage, network conditions of instances, and the number of requests that an instance concurrently processes. Valid values: false: disables the collection of instance-level metrics. This is the default value. true: enables the collection of instance-level metrics.

enableRequestMetrics.description: Specifies whether to enable request-level metrics. If you enable this feature, you can view the amount of time and memory consumed for a specific invocation of each function in the service. Valid values: false: disables request-level metrics. true: enables request-level metrics. This is the default value.

logstore.description: The name of the Logstore of Simple Log Service.

project.description: The name of the project in Simple Log Service.

MNSTopicTriggerConfig.description: The configurations of the Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS) topic trigger.

filterTag.description: The filtering tag. Function execution is triggered only when a message that contains the specified filter tag is received.

notifyContentFormat.description:
The format of the event content. The following two formats are supported:

*   **JSON**
*   **STREAM**

>  The default format is STREAM.

notifyStrategy.description:
The retry policy.

*   **BACKOFF_RETRY**: a backoff retry policy. A total of 3 retries are made. The interval between 2 retries is a random value between 10 and 20 seconds. This is the default value.
*   **EXPONENTIAL_DECAY_RETRY**: an exponential decay retry policy. A total of 176 retries are made, with the interval of each retry increases exponentially to 512 seconds, and the total retry period is 1 day. The interval between two consecutive retries exponentially increases to a maximum of 512 seconds. For example, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 512... 512. The number of 512s is 167.

NASConfig.description: The information about the configurations of the Apsara File Storage NAS (NAS) file system.

items.description: The information about the mount target.

NASMountConfig.description: The information about the Apsara File Storage NAS (NAS) mount targets.

enableTLS.description: Specifies whether to use the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to secure data transmission. Note: Only General-purpose NAS supports transmission encryption.

serverAddr.description: The address of a NAS server.

OSSMountConfig.description: The mount configurations of Object Storage Service (OSS).

items.description: The configurations of the OSS mount target.

bucketName.description: The OSS bucket that you want to mount.

bucketPath.description: The path of the mounted OSS bucket.

events.description: The list of events. Enter an event related to OSS. For more information about event types,see [OSS events](~~2513613~~).

items.description: The name of the event type. The name of the event type can contain wildcard characters. For more information about event types, see [OSS events](~~2513613~~).

location.description: The address of the code package.

repositoryType.description: The type of the code package.

OutputFuncCode.description: The information about the function code package.

checksum.description: The CRC-64 value of the function code package.

url.description: The URL of the function code package.

items.description: The HTTP method. The following methods are supported: HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, and OPTIONS.

ProvisionConfig.description: The provisioned instance configurations of the function.

alwaysAllocateCPU.description: Specify whether to always allocate CPUs to function instances.

alwaysAllocateGPU.description: Specify whether to always allocate GPUs to function instances.

current.description: The actual number of provisioned instances.

currentError.description: The error message returned if a provisioned instance fails to be created.

functionArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the function.

scheduledActions.description: The configurations of scheduled auto scaling.

items.description: The policy of scheduled auto scaling.

target.description: The number of target provisioned instances.

targetTrackingPolicies.description: The configurations of metric-based auto scaling.

PublishVersionInput.description: The request parameters of publishing versions.

description.description: The description of the layer version.

asyncTask.description: Optional. Specify whether to enable the asynchronous task feature.

destinationConfig.description: Optional. The struct of the destination of asynchronous invocations.

maxAsyncEventAgeInSeconds.description: Optional. The maximum validity period of a message. Valid values: \[1,604800]. Default value: 86400. Unit: seconds.

maxAsyncRetryAttempts.description: Optional. The maximum number of retries if an asynchronous invocation fails. Valid values: \[0,8]. If you do not configure this parameter, the default number of retries is 3.

reservedConcurrency.description: The reserved concurrency of the function. Other functions cannot use the concurrency. The reserved concurrency includes the total concurrency of provisioned instances and on-demand instances.

alwaysAllocateCPU.description: Specify whether to always allocate CPUs. Default value: true.

alwaysAllocateGPU.description: Specify whether to always allocate GPUs. Default value: true.

scheduledActions.description: The configurations of scheduled auto scaling.

items.description: The policy of scheduled auto scaling.

target.description: The number of target provisioned instances. Valid values: \[0,10000].

targetTrackingPolicies.description: The configurations of metric-based auto scaling.

RegexRule.description: The regex rewrite configurations for custom domain names.

Resource.description: The details of the resource tags.

resouceType.description: The name of the resource type. Valid values: ALIYUN::FC::FUNCTION and ALIYUN::FC::SERVICE. The former name is used in Function Compute 3.0, and the latter name is used in earlier versions of Function Compute.

resourceArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

RetryStrategy.description: The information about the retry policy that is used if the event fails to be pushed.

PushRetryStrategy.description:
The retry policy. Valid values:

*   **BACKOFF_RETRY**: retries with a fixed backoff interval.
*   **EXPONENTIAL_DECAY_RETRY**: retries with exponential backoff.

RouteConfig.description: The information about the configurations of the route matching rule.

RunOptions.description: The runtime configurations of the EventBridge-based trigger.

deadLetterQueue.description: Specifies whether to enable dead-letter queues. If you configure this parameter, dead-letter queues are enabled. By default, dead-letter queues are not enabled. Messages are discarded if the retry failed. Dead-letter queues are supported for the following Alibaba Cloud services:Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS) , ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ, ApsaraMQ for Kafka, and EventBridge.

errorsTolerance.description:
The fault tolerance policy. Valid values:

*   **NONE**: does not tolerate exceptions.
*   **ALL**: tolerates all exceptions.

>  The default value is **NONE**.

mode.description:
The underlying application mode when message data is pushed to Function Compute. Valid values:

*   **event-streaming**: the event streaming mode. In this mode, events are pushed in arrays. One or more message events are pushed to the function in batches based on your push configurations. This mode is suitable for end-to-end streaming data processing scenarios. The event streaming mode supports the following event sources: Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS), ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ, ApsaraMQ for RabbitMQ, ApsaraMQ for Kafka, ApsaraMQ for MQTT, and Data Transmission Service (DTS).
*   **event-driven**: the event mode. In event mode, each single message is passed to the function as an event parameter at a time. The event follows the CloudEvents specifications. The event mode supports the following event sources: Default, Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS), ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ, and ApsaraMQ for RabbitMQ. Note that in this mode, batch configurations are not supported.

retryStrategy.description: The information about the retry policy that is used if events fail to be pushed.

ScheduledAction.description: The configurations of scheduled auto scaling.

endTime.description: The time when the policy expires.

startTime.description: The time when the policy takes effect.

target.description: The number of target provisioned instances.

timeZone.description: The time zone. If the time zone parameter is empty, the value of startTime, endTime, and scheduleExpression must be in UTC format.

SLSTriggerConfig.description: The configurations of the Simple Log Service trigger.

enable.description: Specifies whether to enable the trigger.

functionParameter.description: The invocation configurations. Simple Log Service passes the configurations into the function as part of the event. The configuration content must be a JSON string.

additionalProperties.description: The content of the invocation configuration. Simple Log Service passes the configurations into the function as part of the event. The configuration content must be a JSON string.

jobConfig.description: The interval at which the trigger reads logs, and the retry configuration upon errors.

logConfig.description: The log configurations of the trigger.

sourceConfig.description: The configurations of the trigger source.

SLSTriggerLogConfig.description: The log configurations of the Simple Log Service trigger.

logstore.description: The name of the Logstore. Exceptions and function execution statistics during function triggering are recorded in the Logstore.

project.description: The name of the project. Exceptions that occur during function triggering and execution statistics are recorded in the Logstore under the project.

SourceConfig.description: The event source configurations of the Simple Log Service.

logstore.description: The name of the Logstore. The trigger periodically subscribes to data from this Logstore and then triggers the function.

startTime.description: The start time of consumption. Unit: seconds. If you do not specify this parameter, consumption starts from the latest data. If this parameter is specified, a trigger event is generated for data written after the specified time. For consumption of existing data, the trigger interval is ignored to catch up with the consumption delay until the real-time trigger progress is caught up. When the catch-up is complete, the trigger starts to trigger function invocations based on the specified trigger event interval without delay.

InstanceId.description: The ID of the EventBridge instance.

Network.description: The network type. Default value: Default. The value PublicNetwork specifies a virtual private cloud (VPC) network.

OffsetReset.description: The offset. earliest: consumes messages from the earliest offset. latest: consumes messages from the latest offset.

SecurityGroupId.description: The ID of the security group.

Topic.description: The name of the topic in the ApsaraMQ for Kafka instance.

SourceMNSParameters.description: The custom event source configurations of Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS) in EventBridge.

IsBase64Decode.description: Specify whether to enable Base64 encoding. Default value: true. Valid values: true false

QueueName.description: The name of the Simple Message Queue (formerly MNS) queue.

SourceRocketMQParameters.description: The custom event source configurations of ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ.

AuthType.description: The authentication type. Set the value to ACL or leave the value empty. The value ACL indicates that authentication is enabled. In this case, you must specify InstanceUsername and InstancePassword.

GroupID.description: The ID of the consumer group of the ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ instance.

InstanceEndpoint.description: The information about the endpoint of the ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ instance.

InstanceId.description: The ID of the ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ instance.

InstanceType.description: The type of ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ instance.

InstanceUsername.description: The username of the ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ instance. If you use the Internet, you must configure the username and password of the instance in the SDK code for authentication.

InstanceVSwitchIds.description: The ID of the vSwitch associated with the instance.

InstanceVpcId.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) associated with the instance.

Offset.description: The consumer offset of the message. CONSUME_FROM_LAST_OFFSET: consumes messages from the latest offset. This is the default value. CONSUME_FROM_FIRST_OFFSET: consumes messages from the earliest offset. CONSUME_FROM_TIMESTAMP: consumes messages from the offset at the specified point in time.

RegionId.description: The region to which the ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ queue belongs.

Tag.description: The tags that are used to filter messages.

Timestamp.description: The timestamp. This parameter is valid only when you set Offset to CONSUME_FROM_TIMESTAMP.

Topic.description: The name of the topic in the ApsaraMQ for RocketMQ instance.

The name of the resource type.

The function type in Function Compute 3.0 is ALIYUN::FC::FUNCTION, which is abbreviated as "function".

TagResourceInput.description: The resource to which you want to add a tag.

TagResourcesInput.description: The resource to which you want to add a tag.

endTime.description: The end time of the policy, in UTC.

maxCapacity.description: The maximum number of provisioned instances for scale-out.

metricTarget.description: The threshold value for metric-based auto scaling.

metricType.description: The metric type for tracing. ProvisionedConcurrencyUtilization: the concurrency utilization of provisioned instances. CPUUtilization: the CPU utilization. GPUMemUtilization: the GPU utilization.

minCapacity.description: The minimum number of provisioned instances for scale-in.

startTime.description: The time when the policy starts to take effect, in UTC.

timeZone.description: The time zone. If the time zone parameter is empty, the time of startTime and endTime must be in UTC format.

TimerTriggerConfig.description: The configurations of the time trigger.

cronExpression.description: The trigger period expression. You can specify to trigger based on a time interval. For example, the expression @every 4m indicates that the triggering is performed every four minutes. You can also specify to trigger based on a cron expression, for example, 0 0 4 \* \* \*.

enable.description: Specify whether to enable the trigger.

payload.description: Enter custom parameters. The trigger message is used as the value of the payload in the event.

TLSConfig.description: The configurations of Transport Layer Security (TLS).

maxVersion.description: The latest TLS version number. Valid values: TLSv1.3, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.1, and TLSv1.0.

minVersion.description: The earliest TLS version number. Valid values: TLSv1.3, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.1, and TLSv1.0.

params.description: The parameters of Managed Service for OpenTelemetry. Specify the value in the map\[string]string format, where the key is "endpoint", and the value is the internal endpoint of Tracing Analysis. Example: endpoint: http://tracing-analysis-dc-hz.aliyuncs.com/adapt_xxx/api/otlp/traces.

type.description: The type of protocol for Managed Service for OpenTelemetry. Only Jaeger is supported.

createdTime.description: The time when the trigger was created.

httpTrigger.description: The information about the HTTP trigger.

invocationRole.description: The role that is used by the event source such as OSS to invoke the function.

triggerId.description: The unique ID of the trigger.

triggerName.description: The name of the trigger. The name contains only letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length and cannot start with a digit or hyphen (-).

protocol.description: The protocol type that is supported by the custom domain name. Valid values: HTTP HTTPS HTTP,HTTPS

routeConfig.description: The route table that maps paths to functions when the function is invoked by using the custom domain name.

UpdateFunctionInput.description: The request parameters for updating the function.

code.description: The code of the function. The code must be packaged into a ZIP file. You must configure one of the code parameter and the customContainerConfig parameter.

cpu.description: The number of vCPUs of the function. The value is a multiple of 0.05.

customContainerConfig.description: The configurations of the Custom Container runtime. After you configure the Custom Container runtime, Function Compute can execute the function in a custom container image. You must configure one of the code parameter and the customContainerConfig parameter.

customRuntimeConfig.description: The configurations of the custom runtime.

diskSize.description: The disk size of the function. Unit: MB. Valid values: 512 and 10240.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables of the function. You can access the environment variables configured in the runtime.

gpuConfig.description: The GPU configurations of the function.

handler.description: The handler of the function. The format of the handler is related to the runtime you use.

instanceConcurrency.description: The number of requests that can be concurrently processed by the instance.

instanceLifecycleConfig.description: The configurations of instance lifecycle hooks.

internetAccess.title: service config
internetAccess.description: Specifies whether to allow the function to access the Internet.

layers.description: An array that consists of the information of layers. Multiple layers are merged based on the order of array subscripts. The content of a layer with a smaller subscript overwrites the file that has the same name as a layer with a larger subscript.

items.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the layer.

logConfig.description: The log configurations. Function Compute writes function execution logs to the specified Logstore.

memorySize.description: The memory size of the function. Unit: MB. The value must be a multiple of 64. The memory size varies based on the function instance type.

nasConfig.description: The configuration of the NAS file system. The configurations allow functions in the specified service to access the NAS file system.

ossMountConfig.description: The mount configurations of Object Storage Service (OSS).

role.description: The Resource Access Management (RAM) role that is used to grant the required permissions to Function Compute. You can use the RAM role in the following scenarios: 1. Send the logs that the function generates to your Logstore. 2. Generate temporary tokens that are used to access other cloud resources during function execution.

timeout.description: The timeout period for the execution of the function. Unit: seconds. Default value: 3. Minimum value: 1. When this period is elapsed, the function execution is terminated.

tracingConfig.description: The configuration of Tracing Analysis. After Function Compute is integrated with Managed Service for OpenTelemetry, you can record the duration of a request in Function Compute, view the cold start duration of a function, and record the execution duration of a function.

vpcConfig.description: The VPC configurations. The configurations allow functions in the specified service to access the specified VPC.

UpdateTriggerInput.description: The information about request parameters for updating the trigger.

invocationRole.description: The role that is used by the event source such as object Storage Service (OSS) to invoke the function.

qualifier.description: The version or alias of the service to which the function belongs.

triggerConfig.description: The configuration of the trigger. The configuration vary based on the trigger type.

createdTime.description: The time when the version was created.

description.description: The description of the layer version.

lastModifiedTime.description: The time when the version was last updated.

securityGroupId.description: The ID of the security group.

enableWAF.description: Specifies whether to enable WAF protection.

CreateCustomDomain.description: If you want to use a fixed domain name to access an application or function in a production environment of Function Compute, or to resolve the issue of forced downloads when accessing an HTTP trigger, you can bind a custom domain name to the application or function.

CreateFunction.title: CreateFunction
CreateFunction.description: Resources of Function Compute are scheduled and run based on functions. A function usually refers to a code snippet that is written by a user and can be independently executed to respond to events and requests.

schema.description: The prefix of the function name.
The number of functions to return. The minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 100.

schema.title: v3v2v3: FC3.0v2FC2.0FC3.0FC2.0
schema.description: The version of Function Compute to which the functions belong. Valid values: v3 and v2. v3: only lists functions of Function Compute 3.0. v2: only lists functions of Function Compute 2.0. By default, this parameter is left empty and functions in both Function Compute 2.0 and Function Compute 3.0 are listed.

ListFunctions.title: ListFunctions

schema.description: The version or alias of the function.
The type of function invocation. Valid values: Sync and Async.
The log type of function invocation. Valid values: None and Tail.
The request parameters of function invocation.

The ID of the asynchronous task. You must enable the asynchronous task feature in advance.

>  If you use an SDK to invoke a function, we recommend that you specify a business-related ID to facilitate subsequent operations. For example, a video processing function can use video file names as invocation IDs. This way, you can easily check whether a video is successfully processed or terminated before it is processed. The ID can start only with letters or underscores. An ID can contain *letters, digits (0 - 9), underscores*, and hyphens (-). It can be up to 128 characters in length. If you do not specify the ID of the asynchronous invocation, the system automatically generates an ID.
The response parameters of function invocation

TagResources.title: TagResources
TagResources.description: Tags are used to identify resources. Tags allow you to categorize, search for, and aggregate resources that have the same characteristics from different dimensions. This facilitates resource management. For more information, see [Tag overview](~~156983~~).

schema.description:
The tags.

You can query up to 20 tags at a time.

Key.description:
The tag key.

The tag key can be up to 64 characters in length, and cannot contain `http://` or `https://`. The tag key cannot start with `aliyun` or `acs:`.

Value.description:
The tag value.

The tag value can be up to 128 characters in length and can be an empty string.

The number of resources to return.

The resource ID.

GetAsyncTask.summary: Queries the information about an asynchronous task.

schema.title: id
schema.description: The ID of the asynchronous task.
The version or alias of the function.
The asynchronous task information. The returnPayload parameter is in beta test. If you want to use this parameter, [contact us](~~2513733~~).

GetAsyncTask.title: GetAsyncTask

schema.title: id
schema.description: The ID prefix of asynchronous tasks. If this parameter is specified, a list of asynchronous tasks whose IDs match the prefix is returned.

The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken.
The number of asynchronous tasks to return. Valid values: \[1,100]. Default value: 20.
The version or alias of the function.

schema.title: Enqueued Running Succeeded Failed Stopped Expired
schema.description:
The state of asynchronous tasks. The following items list the states of an asynchronous task:

*   Enqueued: The asynchronous invocation is enqueued and is waiting to be executed.
*   Succeeded: The invocation is successful.
*   Failed: The invocation fails.
*   Running: The invocation is being executed.
*   Stopped: The invocation is terminated.
*   Stopping: The invocation is being terminated.
*   Invalid: The invocation is invalid and not executed due to specific reasons. For example, the function is deleted.
*   Expired: The maximum validity period of messages is specified for asynchronous invocation. The invocation is discarded and not executed because the specified maximum validity period has elapsed.
*   Retrying: The asynchronous invocation is being retried due to an execution error.
The start time of the period during which the asynchronous tasks are initiated.
The end time of the period during which the asynchronous tasks are initiated.

schema.title: asc desc
schema.description:
The order in which the returned asynchronous tasks are sorted.

*   asc: in ascending order.
*   desc: in descending order.

Specifies whether to return input parameters of the asynchronous tasks. Valid values:

*   true: returns the `invocationPayload` parameter in the response.
*   false: does not return the `invocationPayload` parameter in the response.

>  The `invocationPayload` parameter indicates the input parameters of an asynchronous task.

schema.title: id
schema.description: The ID of the asynchronous task.
The version or alias of the function.
